title: INTERSPEECH_2008_28_abs

sentences.text: A critical step in encoding sound for neuronal processing occurs when the analog pressure wave is coded into discrete nerve-action potentials .

Recent pool models of the inner hair cell synapse do not reproduce the dead time period after an intense stimulus , so we used visual inspection and automatic speech recognition -LRB- ASR -RRB- to investigate an offset adaptation -LRB- OA -RRB- model proposed by Zhang et al. -LSB- 1 -RSB- .
OA improved phase locking in the auditory nerve -LRB- AN -RRB- and raised ASR accuracy for features derived from AN fibers -LRB- ANFs -RRB- .
We also found that OA is crucial for auditory processing by onset neurons -LRB- ONs -RRB- in the next neuronal stage , the auditory brainstem .
Multi-layer perceptrons -LRB- MLPs -RRB- performed much better than standard Gaussian mixture models -LRB- GMMs -RRB- for both our ANF-based and ON-based auditory features .
Similar results were previously obtained with MSG -LRB- Modulation-filtered Spec-troGram -RRB- auditory features -LSB- 2 -RSB- .
Thus we believe researchers working with novel features should consider trying MLPs .

Entity-auditory_processing_by_onset_neur.label: auditory processing by onset neurons -LRB- ONs -RRB-
aliases: auditory processing by onset neurons -LRB- ONs -RRB-
Entity-auditory_processing_by_onset_neur.description: The process of encoding sound information by specialized neurons that respond to the onset of sounds.

aliases: raised ASR accuracy for features derived from AN fibers
Entity-raised_asr_accuracy_for_feature_d.description: The offset adaptation model that improved phase locking in the auditory nerve and increased automatic speech recognition accuracy for features derived from auditory nerve fibers.

mentions.local_name: raised ASR accuracy for features derived from AN fibers

Entity-encoding_sound_for_neuronal_proce.label: encoding sound for neuronal processing
Entity-encoding_sound_for_neuronal_proce.description: The process of converting analog pressure waves from sound into discrete nerve-action potentials, which are then processed by neurons in the auditory system.

Entity-a_critical_step.label: A critical step
Entity-a_critical_step.description: The process of converting an analog pressure wave into discrete nerve-action potentials, marking a crucial stage in encoding sound for neuronal processing.

aliases: features derived from AN fibers -LRB- ANFs -RRB-

Entity-on-based_auditory_feature.label: ON-based auditory features
Entity-on-based_auditory_feature.description: Auditory features derived from onset neurons (ONs) that are used as input to machine learning models for speech recognition or other audio processing tasks.

Entity-oa_improved_phase_locking_in_the_.label: OA improved phase locking in the auditory nerve
aliases: OA improved phase locking in the auditory nerve
Entity-oa_improved_phase_locking_in_the_.description: A phenomenon or observation of improved phase locking in the auditory nerve

Entity-discrete_nerve-action_potential.label: discrete nerve-action potentials
Entity-discrete_nerve-action_potential.description: Discrete nerve-action potentials refer to the encoded sound signals transmitted by neurons in response to analog pressure waves, representing a critical step in neuronal processing.

Entity-the_analog_pressure_wave.label: the analog pressure wave
Entity-the_analog_pressure_wave.description: The analog pressure wave refers to an acoustic signal, specifically the mechanical compression and rarefaction of air particles in sound waves, which is converted into electrical signals by sensory hair cells in the inner ear.

Entity-the_next_neuronal_stage__the_audi.label: the next neuronal stage, the auditory brainstem
aliases: the next neuronal stage, the auditory brainstem
Entity-the_next_neuronal_stage__the_audi.description: The part of the brain responsible for processing sound information from onset neurons after an intense stimulus.

mentions.local_name: the next neuronal stage, the auditory brainstem

Entity-ons.label: ONs
Entity-ons.description: ONs refer to a type of neuron found in the auditory brainstem that is responsible for processing sound information.

Entity-msg.label: MSG
Entity-msg.description: A modulation technique or algorithm used to process and analyze audio signals

Entity-asr_accuracy.label: ASR accuracy
Entity-asr_accuracy.description: The measure of the ability to recognize spoken language accurately.

Entity-similar_result.label: Similar results
Entity-similar_result.description: Previous research has obtained similar outcomes using Modulation-filtered SpectroGram (MSG) auditory features.

Entity-onset_neuron.label: onset neurons
Entity-onset_neuron.description: A type of neuron that is involved in processing information related to the onset or beginning of sensory stimuli.

Entity-auditory_brainstem.description: A part of the brain responsible for processing and transmitting sound information.

Entity-auditory_nerve.description: A bundle of nerve fibres responsible for transmitting sound information from the cochlea to the brain.

Entity-inner_hair_cell_synapse.label: inner hair cell synapse
Entity-inner_hair_cell_synapse.description: A synapse that connects inner hair cells to other neurons or sensory receptors, facilitating communication and information processing.

Entity-multi-layer_perceptrons.label: Multi-layer perceptrons
Entity-multi-layer_perceptrons.description: A type of neural network architecture that consists of multiple layers of interconnected nodes or neurons.

Entity-nerve-action_potential.label: nerve-action potentials
Entity-nerve-action_potential.description: Electrical impulses transmitted along neurons, resulting from the rapid depolarization of axonal membranes.

Entity-analog_pressure_wave.label: analog pressure wave
Entity-analog_pressure_wave.description: A type of mechanical signal characterized by variations in air or fluid pressure propagating through a medium.

Entity-the_dead_time_period_after_an_int.description: The period of time following an intense stimulus during which there is no neuronal processing or response.

Entity-gaussian_mixture_model.description: A statistical model that combines multiple Gaussian distributions to represent complex data

summary: A critical step in encoding sound for neuronal processing occurs when the analog pressure wave is coded into discrete nerve-action potentials . Recent pool models of the inner hair cell synapse do not reproduce the dead time period after an intense stimulus , so we used visual inspection and automatic speech recognition -LRB- ASR -RRB- to investigate an offset adaptation -LRB- OA -RRB- model proposed by Zhang et al. -LSB- 1 -RSB- . OA improved phase locking in the auditory nerve -LRB- AN -RRB- and raised ASR accuracy for features derived from AN fibers -LRB- ANFs -RRB- . We also found that OA is crucial for auditory processing by onset neurons -LRB- ONs -RRB- in the next neuronal stage , the auditory brainstem . Multi-layer perceptrons -LRB- MLPs -RRB- performed much better than standard Gaussian mixture models -LRB- GMMs -RRB- for both our ANF-based and ON-based auditory features . Similar results were previously obtained with MSG -LRB- Modulation-filtered Spec-troGram -RRB- auditory features -LSB- 2 -RSB- . Thus we believe researchers working with novel features should consider trying MLPs .

Predicate-is_coded_into.label: is coded into
Predicate-is_coded_into.description: The predicate 'is coded into' indicates a relationship where the subject (a signal or information) is transformed or represented in a specific way, resulting in the object. This transformation can involve simplification, abstraction, or reorganization of the original information to make it more suitable for processing, storage, or transmission.

Predicate-occurs_when.label: occurs when
Predicate-occurs_when.description: The predicate 'occurs when' indicates a temporal relationship between the subject and object. It specifies that an event or state described by the subject takes place at the moment or during the time period denoted by the object.

Predicate-do_not_reproduce.label: do not reproduce
Predicate-do_not_reproduce.description: The predicate 'do not reproduce' indicates a prohibition or inhibition on the subject's ability to replicate or generate something in relation to the object. It suggests that there is an obstacle, constraint, or limitation preventing the subject from reproducing or producing something during the specified time period (object).

Predicate-is_crucial_for.label: is crucial for
Predicate-is_crucial_for.description: The predicate 'is crucial for' indicates a relationship where the subject plays an essential or vital role in achieving, facilitating, or enabling the object. It suggests that the subject is necessary or indispensable for the object to function properly, operate effectively, or achieve its intended purpose.

Predicate-than.label: than
Predicate-than.description: The predicate 'than' indicates a comparison or contrast between two entities. It suggests that the subject and object have distinct characteristics, properties, or values, with the subject being compared to or differing from the object.

Predicate-should_consider_trying.label: should consider trying
Predicate-should_consider_trying.description: The predicate 'should consider trying' indicates that the subject (e.g. researchers) ought to evaluate or explore the object (e.g. MLPs), potentially as a means of gaining insight, improving their understanding, or achieving some other desired outcome.

Predicate-improved.label: improved
Predicate-improved.description: The predicate 'improved' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject has enhanced or optimized the process or outcome described by the object.

Predicate-occurs.label: occurs
Predicate-occurs.description: The predicate 'occurs' indicates a relationship of causality or association between the subject and object, suggesting that the action or process described by the subject leads to or is accompanied by the outcome or phenomenon denoted by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject (a concept or entity) is related to its more general category or classification, which is represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the subject can be subsumed under or falls within the scope of the object.
